Title:
Molecular phylogeny of some taxa within the tribe Cernuellini
Schileyko, 1991 from Tunisia (Geomitridae, Helicellinae), with
description of Sabessebia nov. gen.
Journal:
Journal of Zoological Systematics and Evolutionary
Research
Keywords:
Cernuellini, new genus, revision, Sabessebia zitanica,
Tunisia
Abstract:
The generic relationship of some taxa within the tribe
Cernuellini is presented. The data presented corroborate the position of
the genus Xeroplana as a member of the Cernuellini, and its separation
from Cernuella on genus level. A short characterisation of the species
confined to Xeroplana is presented. The phylogenetic analysis of two
mitochondrial markers (COI and 16S) and two nuclear markers
(5.8S-ITS2-28S and H3) confirms the status of Sabessebia nov. gen. The
new genus, Sabessebia nov. gen. is proposed for Helix zitanica
Letourneux & Bourguignat, 1887, which is also located in this tribe.
For the first time, genetic data of the type species of Cernuella,
Cochlea virgata Da Costa, 1778, from its type area England is published
to support the further investigation of taxa comprised within the
Cernuella species-complex. Cernuella virgata from England is monomorphic
for all markers used, indicating a very close relationship of the
populations investigated; probably, this is result of a recent dispersal
event.
